conditions.name: Influenza (Flu)
conditions.details: Caused by influenza viruses, highly contagious respiratory illness.

conditions.name: Common Cold
conditions.details: Caused by various viruses, most commonly rhinoviruses.

conditions.name: Pneumonia
conditions.details: Inflammation of the air sacs in one or both lungs, usually caused by infection.

conditions.name: Diabetes Mellitus
conditions.details: Chronic condition affecting how your body turns food into energy.

conditions.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
conditions.details: Persistent elevation of blood pressure in the arteries.

conditions.name: Asthma
conditions.details: Chronic respiratory condition causing inflammation and narrowing of the airways.
symptoms: Coughing, especially at night or early morning

conditions.name: Gastroenteritis (Stomach Flu)
conditions.details: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, usually caused by viral or bacterial infection.

conditions.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
conditions.details: Infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, ureters, and urethra.
symptoms: Pain or burning sensation during urination

conditions.name: Arthritis
conditions.details: Inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness. Arthritis is a disease that causes damage in your joints. Joints are places in your body where two bones meet. Osteoarthritis is the most common type. Studies have found that around half of all adults will develop osteoarthritis at some point.
symptoms: a feeling of heat or warmth in the joint

conditions.name: Migraine
conditions.details: Neurological condition characterized by recurrent, severe headaches often accompanied by other symptoms.A migraine headache is caused by abnormal brain activity. This activity can be triggered by many things. But the exact chain of events remains unclear. Most medical experts believe the attack begins in the brain and involves nerve pathways and chemicals. The changes affect blood flow in the brain and surrounding tissues
symptoms: Intense throbbing or pulsing headache, often on one side of the head

conditions.name: Malaria
conditions.details: Malaria is a life-threatening disease spread to humans by some types of mosquitoes. It is mostly found in tropical countries. It is preventable and curable.
symptoms: jaundice (yellowing of the eyes and skin)
